Question G

_— — Suppose the Item Placement Cutoff Date on a payment plan has a value
Y of Due Date. How does the setting impact invoice items on a policy that
: uses the payment plan?

~- SSS 55555555 55=->=-=

Answer Gl

_~ — Suppose the Item Placement Cutoff Date on a payment plan has a value
Y of Due Date. How does the setting impact invoice items on a policy that
: uses the payment plan?

If account-level billing is being used, each invoice item will be placed on the earliest
invoice whose due date comes on or after the invoice item’s placement date. If policy-
level billing is being used, the setting is ignored.

~- SSS 5S 555555 5-5 =--=

Question G

,~ — Suppose an account with account-evel billing has three policies: a
Y monthly, a yearly, and a weekly.

a. How many invoice streams does the account have?

b. If the account switches to policy-level billing, will the number of
invoice streams be changed?

~- SSS 55555555 55=->=-=

Answer Gl

,— — Suppose an account with accountevel billing has three policies: a
Y monthly, a yearly, and a weekly.

a. How many invoice streams does the account have?

b. If the account switches to policy-level billing, will the number of
invoice streams be changed?

a. Two. Monthly and yearly use the same invoice stream; weekly requires a
second invoice stream.

b. Yes. The number of invoice streams will be either three (one for each policy)
or four (one for each policy plus a monthly one for existing account-level
charges such as a late fee).

~- SSS 5S 555555 5-5 =--=
